Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  




public class Grid
extends greenfoot.Actor

Creates the grid using a 2D array to make the basis of the game. The grids are modular and can be used in any future games as they can create a grid of any desired size. Should call the loadLocations() method to add the locations to the world to create the tiles.

Version:
June 2018
Author:
Maggie, Catherine

Constructor Detail

Grid

public Grid(char[][] array,
            int width,
            int length,
            char scene)
Creates a grid of varying dimensions and tile size using a 2d array based off of a 2d character array.

Parameters:
array - A 2d array of characters used to create the grid.
width - Width of the tile. Must be greater than 0. The tile width multiplied by the amount of tiles across must be equal to or less than the world size.
length - Length of the tile. Must be greater than 0. The tile length multiplied by the amount of tiles down must be greater or equal to the world size.
scene - Character used to differentiate the different scenes. u: underwater, f: fire, g: grass

Grid

public Grid(int tilesAcross,
            int tilesDown,
            int width,
            int length,
            char scene)
Creates a grid of varying dimensions and tile size using a 2d array.

Parameters:
tilesAcross - Amount of tiles wanted horizontally. Must be greater than 0.
tilesDown - Amount of tiles wanted vertically. Must be greater than 0.
width - Width of the tile. Must be greater than 0. The tile width multiplied by the amount of tiles across must be equal to or less than the world size.
length - Length of the tile. Must be greater than 0. The tile length multiplied by the amount of tiles down must be greater or equal to the world size.
scene - Character used to differentiate the different scenes. u: underwater, f: fire, g: grass
Method Detail

getState

public char getState(int xCoord,
                     int yCoord)
Getter method for the state of a tile at a specified coordinate

Parameters:
xCoord - x-coordinate of the location you want the state of
yCoord - y-coordinate of the location you want the state of
Returns:
int Character that tells the state of the tile (1 --> obstacle, p --> path, a --> empty1, b --> empty2, s--> start, f --> finish)

int Length of a tile

setState

public void setState(int xCoord,
                     int yCoord,
                     char state)
Sets the state of a tile at a specified location.

Parameters:
xCoord - x-coordinate of the location you want the set the state of
yCoord - y-coordinate of the location you want to set the state of
state - The state you want to set to (1 --> obstacle, p --> path, a --> empty1, b --> empty2, s--> start, f --> finish)
